titleStmt.title: Universal concord the sufficient terms proposed for the use of those that have liberty to use them, and as the authors profession of his own religion, in contentious, dividing age / by Richard Baxter.
titleStmt.author: Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.

titleStmt.title: Universal concord the sufficient terms proposed for the use of those that have liberty to use them, and as the authors profession of his own religion, in contentious, dividing age / by Richard Baxter.
titleStmt.author: Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.W. for Nevil Simmons ...,

notesStmt.note: Contains also a catechism with special t.p.: The Christian religion, expressed briefly in the ancient creeds, the Ten Commandments, and the Lords prayer, and more largely in a profession taken out of the Holy Scriptures.
Reproduction of original in British Library.
Imperfect: text is lacking on film. Only "To the reader" signed by Richard Baxter appears.
